go_to_checkout_for_final_price: Go to checkout for final price
drag_and_drop_file: Drag and drop files here or click to upload
shipping_checkbox: Default shipping address for future purchases
billing_checkbox: Default billing address for future purchases
write_review_condition: You will be able to write a product review when the order status is confirmed.
product_already_reviewed_condition: You have already reviewed this product.
select_products_in_campaign_description: Select from the above list the products you want to add to the campaign and the discounts related to each product
does_the_campaign_belong_to_a_social_cau: Does the campaign belong to a social cause?
era_tooltip: Each beer has a period in which it was brewed. Craft era: developed in the modern era; Traditional era: developed before the modern era of craft beer; Historical era: of low production and not brewed today.
origin_tooltip: Region, country or continent of origin of the beer.
family_tooltip: Styles can be grouped into style families that can be compared and contrasted.
color_tooltip: SRM (Standard Reference Method) measures the intensity of a given wavelength of light. hese numerical values do not always match our visual perception of the lightness and darkness of the color or hue. visual perception of the lightness and darkness of color or hue. For example, a light yellow beer may have an SRM value of may have an SRM value of 4, while a dark yellow beer may have an SRM value of 8. may have an SRM value of 8.
intensity_tooltip: Beer strength refers to the amount of sugar that has been converted to alcohol. The higher the value, the more alcohol the beer has.
ibu_tooltip: IBU (INTERNATIONAL BITTERNESS UNITS) is a scale for measuring the perceived bitterness of beer.
aroma_tooltip: Beer aroma refers to the perception of the odors emanating from the beer.
fermentation_tooltip: Fermentation is the process by which yeast transforms sugar into alcohol. Ale: fermentation with top-fermenting yeast; Lager: fermentation with bottom-fermenting yeast; Mixed: fermentation with both top-fermenting and bottom-fermenting yeasts. Wild: fermentation with wild yeasts. Lagered: fermentation with bottom-fermenting yeast and subsequent cold storage. Barrel-aged: fermentation with bottom-fermenting yeast and subsequent storage in barrels.
products_customize_settings_description: Customize the features of those products you publish. You can add style families that we have not taken into account or are out of the standards we know, among other features. You will be able to see this information updated in the Product creation section.
products_customize_settings_color: Write down those colors of your beer that make it unique.
products_customize_settings_family_style: Add new styles to identify your beer.
add_product_pack_description: Cervezanas products are sold in packs of individual beers, 6, 12, 24, etc. This is the moment where you must indicate how many beers will be sold per pack, their price and all the information related to their sale.
add_product_pack_description_2: To add a pack to the product, click on the button below. Then, indicate how many products you will sell per pack, their price and all the required information.
consumption_points_description: The points of consumption are those places validated by Cervezanas where you can enjoy the best establishments, events and beers. These points can be fixed (breweries with Tap Room, restaurants, etc) or mobile (Barcelona Beer Festival, beer events, etc).
form_submit_cp_organizer_title: Application for registration as an organiser
form_submit_cp_organizer_description: If you are a willing to create an event, you can apply to become an organiser. Once your application has been validated, you will be able to add your events and consumption points.
form_submit_cp_organizer_cover_letter_de: Briefly describe your experience in the beer industry and your motivations for applying to become an organiser of consumption points. If you have any events or drinking points you would like to add, you can indicate this in your cover letter. Feel free to add any information you consider relevant.
form_submit_cp_organizer_cv_description: Please attach your CV so that we can get to know your experience in the beer and event organisation sector.

pvpr_tooltip: It is the Recommended Retail Price, the price advised by producers and brands to retailers and stores. It is a price that takes into account the process and production costs.

tooltips.role_description: The user role determines the permissions the user has on the platform. For the roles of producer and distributor, the user must accept an active contract. The platform is in charge of validating the contract and giving access to the user.

homeheader.meeting_point: EL LUGAR DE ENCUENTRO PARA LOS AMANTES DE LA

highlights.body1: Good beer creates the artisan and this community creates Cervezanas. We create unique experiences for music and beer lovers. We want you to know the craziest beer experiments, those hidden gems made with care for you. We are the bridge between those undiscovered craft beer makers and you.
highlights.header2: Are you a master brewer or do you have your own recipe?
highlights.body2: From Cervezanas we are actively searching for the next aroma, discovering that jewel that you have created and has not yet been released to the world. Do you want to be part of this community of master brewers?

history.brand_history_header: Want to know the story behind each brand?
history.brand_history_body: Cervezanas is responsible for giving value to the work behind each brewer creator, each product in our catalog is provided with a unique identifier capable of being scanned. With it you will have access to exclusive information about that product, in addition to being able to participate in promotions, discounts and exclusive sweepstakes of each brand!
history.adventages_header: You will have access to information about each product and will be able to participate in:

monthlybeers.intro: Each month we present those beers that have been eligible for the quality certificates that we issue from Cervezanas. Giving visibility to those selected by our community of Cervezanos, the committee of experts and the most daring and experimental.

community.manufacturer_body: Damos visibilidad a tu creación, nos encargamos de todo para que puedas centrarte en tu pasión, crear para hacernos disfrutar.Ya tengas tu propia fábrica o tan solo la receta, te ayudamos en todo el proceso de producción.
community.consumer_body: Tú que disfrutas de una buena cerveza, solo aceptamos aquellas que cumplen con los cánones de calidad de Cervezanas. Apostamos por un producto de proximidad y máxima calidad. Nuestra comunidad visibiliza aquellas que consiguen más impacto. Nuestro comité de expertos se encarga de proporcionar las menciones honoríficas a través de nuestro Certificado de calidad Cervezanas.
community.dealers_body: Tú que disfrutas de una buena cerveza, solo aceptamos aquellas que cumplen con los cánones de calidad de Cervezanas. Apostamos por un producto de proximidad y máxima calidad. Nuestra comunidad visibiliza aquellas que consiguen más impacto. Nuestro comité de expertos se encarga de proporcionar las menciones honoríficas a través de nuestro Certificado de calidad Cervezanas.
community.points_body: Generamos comunidad y fomentamos los puntos de encuentro para que nuestros Cervezanos puedan conocerse y dar a conocer sus creaciones. Ya sean puntos fijos o móviles en eventos, catas de cerveza en fábricas o reuniones en hogares con fábricas caseras.

reviews.header: Opiniones de nuestros Cervezanos y Cervezanas
